message.content:
{"id": "18028", "title": "Bug 18028: Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable", "description": "When attempting to rename a package, the software does not check if all the resources within the package are writeable. This bug causes an unexpected exception dialog to appear after the renaming process is finished.", "OB": "The software should check if all resources inside a package are writeable before allowing the package to be renamed.", "EB": "The software allows the renaming of a package even if not all resources within the package are writeable, causing an unexpected exception dialog to be displayed after the renaming process is finished.", "SR": "To reproduce: 

1. Create a package with a compilation unit (CU) inside it.
2. Make the CU readonly.
3. Attempt to rename the package.

Observation: After the renaming process is finished, an unexpected exception dialog is displayed."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '18028', 'title': "Bug 18028Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable", 'description': "Bug 18028Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable ", 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'F1+ create a package with a CU in it make the CU readonly try to rename the package.observe: after finish you get an unexpected exception dialog. '}
